question: Find $\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 4 \\ -6 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}.$
agents_response:
The sum of two vectors $\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \\ c \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{pmatrix}$ is given by adding the corresponding components: 

$\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 4 \\ -6 \end{pmatrix} + \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1+2 \\ 4+(-1) \\ -6+3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}$. 

So, $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}}$ is the final answer.
